item.name: Cart
item.description: Cart endpoints let you do basic cart operations, such as create a cart, add item to the cart, update items, remove items, delete cart, update status of the cart, and more.

description.content: Get all carts belonging to the user or to a merchant by authorization token

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

response.name: OK

description.content: (Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. API Key for Gateway

The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

description.content: (Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

description.content: (Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

description.content: (Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

item.name: Remove an item from the cart

request.name: Remove an item from the cart

description.content: Deletes a specified item from a specified cart
(Required) ID of cart for which the specified item needs to be removed
(Required) Cart item sequence number (starts at 1) of item to be removed from cart

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

description.content: (Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

description.content: (Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

description.content: (Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

item.name: Order Draft
item.description: Order drafts are the final state of a cart, containing all the required information needed to create an order. All these information undergoes validations before being generated and stored as order drafts. Once an order draft is created, it cannot be changed.The following endpoints let you create and manage such order drafts.

description.content: Create an order draft for a given cart. During the order draft creation process, payment details are validated before generating the draft. Additionally, it triggers an event if the "ORDER_DRAFT" webhook event is subscribed.
(Required) ID of the cart for which order draft will be generated

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.

(Required) Cart ID to delete a specific price adjustment information from the cart

The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

item.name: Update a specific price adjustment information for a given cart

request.name: Update a specific price adjustment information for a given cart

description.content: Update a specific price adjustment entity from the list of price adjustments made to the specified cart's total amount. A price adjustment entity is a single object in the price adjustments array.
(Required) Cart ID to update a specific price adjustment information within the cart
(Required) Price adjustment ID; it identifies a single price adjustment object from the list of price adjustments, added for the specified `cartId`.

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

item.name: Get all price adjustments for a cart item

request.name: Get all price adjustments for a cart item

description.content: Get all the price adjustments made to a specific line item within the given cart.
(Required) Cart ID to retrieve price adjustment details of a `lineItemId` within the cart
(Required) Cart item's sequence number (starts at 1) for which price adjustment details are to be retrieved

item.name: Delete a specific price adjustment information for a cart item

request.name: Delete a specific price adjustment information for a cart item

description.content: Delete a specific price adjustment entity from the list of price adjustments made to a particular line item in a given cart. A price adjustment entity is a single object in the price adjustments array.
(Required) Cart ID to delete a specific price adjustment data within the cart
(Required) Cart item's sequence number (starts at 1) for which a price adjustment is to be deleted
(Required) Price adjustment ID; it identifies a particular price adjustment object from the list of price adjustments, added for the specified `lineItemId`.

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

description.content: (Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

item.name: Update a specific price adjustment information for a cart item

request.name: Update a specific price adjustment information for a cart item

description.content: Update a specific price adjustment entity from the list of price adjustments made to a particular line item in a given cart. A price adjustment entity is a single object in the price adjustments array.
(Required) Cart ID to update a specific price adjustment data for a given `lineItemId` within the cart.
(Required) Cart item's sequence number (starts at 1) for which price adjustment information is to be updated within the cart.
(Required) Price adjustment ID; it identifies a single price adjustment object from the list of price adjustments for the specified `lineItemId`.

(Required) The `x-site-context` header is a JSON object that contains information about the source you wish to pull from. The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

The mandatory `account` is the 24 character identifier found in Copilot. The `channel` (Sales channel ID), `stage` (environment name), and `date` attributes can be used to further narrow the scope of your data source.
API Key for Gateway

fabric's Cart APIs let you add, update, and remove items from your Storefront cart, either as a guest user or as a logged-in user. It also provides functionality to merge carts when you switch from guest user to logged-in user, to apply coupon codes and other attributes (for example, gift wrapping) to the cart items. Additionally, it supports more advanced use cases such as using multiple carts within a B2B organization and sharing of carts, as well as supporting a unified cart experience for multi-region and multi-brand businesses.

These APIs provide high performance, scalability, multi-tenancy, and configurability to the end-to-end order processing actions that start from an item being added to the cart, through the pre-checkout stage that includes billing, shipping, and payment details, to the checkout stage where the order is processed and confirmed by the fabric Order Management System (OMS) or alternatively an Order Draft can be created. An order draft can be used to coordinate the creation of an order in any other downstream systems. Contact Support: Name: Cart Support Email: support.cnc@fabric.inc
